availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles D. Moore (Green County, Kentucky, physician and soldier)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, physician and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Nannie Moore. Father of William R. Moore. Physician in Green County, Kentucky, in 1860. Enslaved three people in Green County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as surgeon from January 1, 1862 to June 1, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Greensburg, p. 628
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Greensburg, p. 3.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0266.
